channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: He left Gaza and fled to Europe on a jet ski. Now he hopes to bring his family
item.description: In an extraordinary journey, a Palestinian man used a jet ski to cross the Mediterranean Sea and reach Europe after he fled the war in Gaza.

item.title: Will technology provide a boost to truck drivers — or will it replace them?
item.description: The American economy depends on truckers. Technology is promising to transform this industry with new driver-assistance features that are meant to mak...

item.title: Virginia's tough rules for felons to regain their voting rights could soon be changing
item.description: Virginia is one of just a few states where only the governor can restore voting rights for people with felony convictions. But Virginia's rules may so...

item.title: Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, why Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning
item.description: European leaders are skeptical of President Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, what led Marjorie Taylor Greene to announce she will resign from Cong...

item.title: A bowhead whale's DNA offers clues to fight cancer
item.description: Scientists searching for new ways to combat cancer think they may have uncovered a promising new lead in the DNA of the bowhead whale.

item.title: Play yards sold on Amazon recalled due to life-threatening risk, CPSC says
item.description: Baby play yards sold on Amazon by Anna Queen are being recalled due to the "risk of serious injury or death from suffocation and entrapment hazards," ...

item.title: The shutdown is over. Flights have resumed. Thanksgiving travelers might wonder: What now?
Five dead in suicide bombing in Pakistan
item.description: Authorities have described the attack as a "foiled terrorist plot", noting that the attackers were gunned down at the gate.

item.title: Bollywood's 'He-Man' Dharmendra dies at 89
item.description: Best known for the iconic role of Veeru in the all-time great Sholay, Dharmendra was India's "most handsome actor".

item.title: Wisconsin woman who stabbed classmate to please Slender Man recaptured
item.description: A 23-year-old Wisconsin woman who nearly stabbed a classmate to death to please a horror character called Slender Man has been recaptured in Illinois ...

item.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy hints at "the main problem" with U.S. peace plan
item.description: As U.S. and European officials tout progress in Ukraine peace talks, Zelenskyy says a key sticking point is letting Putin keep "what he has stolen."

item.title: 'No one will support it': Ukraine's soldiers react to US peace plan
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers at the front are angry, defiant and resigned after US plan became public.

item.title: Suicide bombers in Pakistan kill at least 3 at security force headquarters
item.description: Police say two suicide bombers attacked the headquarters of a security force in northwestern Pakistan, killing at least three officers.

item.title: Stores keep prices down in a tough year for turkeys. Other Thanksgiving foods may cost more
Jimmy Cliff, reggae legend and Jamaican icon, dies at 81
item.description: Jimmy Cliff, who famously sang about the "many rivers" we all must cross, has died after suffering a seizure and pneumonia, his family say.

item.title: Fifty children escape after mass school abduction in Nigeria
item.description: The raid on a Christian school came amid a surge of attacks by armed groups in the African nation.

item.title: US and Ukraine signal peace plan progress after Geneva talks
item.description: Both sides say "intensive work" will take place on outstanding issues following talks on a US-backed plan to end the war.

item.title: Thousands of arrests by Trump’s crime-fighting task force in Memphis strain crowded jail and courts
item.description: A task force ordered by President Donald Trump to combat crime in Memphis, Tennessee, has made thousands of arrests.
